arts.ttl: Craig Bellamy keeps unbeaten Wales record alive in Turkey after late penalty drama
arts.sum: TURKEY 0-0 WALES: Craig Bellamy and Wales received a late let-off in their UEFA Nations League match in Turkey as Kerem Akturkoglu hit the post from the penalty spot

arts.ttl: Craig Bellamy felt penalty miss was justice served in Wales’ draw with Turkey
arts.sum: Kerem Akturkoglu failed from the spot late on.

arts.ttl: Justice served in Wales draw against Turkey - Bellamy
arts.sum: Wales boss Craig Bellamy says justice was served as Turkey missed a controversial late penalty in their goalless Nations League draw.

arts.ttl: Wales survive penalty scare to stay unbeaten under Bellamy
arts.sum: Wales maintained their unbeaten record under Craig Bellamy in a 0-0 Nations League draw with Turkey after Kerem Akturkoglu sent his 89th-minute penalty against a post.

arts.ttl: Pleasing Wales player ratings as defensive duo colossal in battling Turkey draw
arts.sum: Here's how the players rated as Wales battled their way to a point in Turkey on Saturday evening

arts.ttl: Wales get late spot of fortune in Turkey stalemate to lift Nations League hopes
arts.sum: Late drama and justice featured in a breathless finish to this riveting encounter. When Neco Williams challenged Yunus Akgun and Connor Roberts tackled Kerem Akturkoglu in the Wales area, each seemed clean yet the referee, Juan Martínez Munuera, awarded a penalty. It was unclear for which player’s (apparent) misdemeanour and the VAR did not intervene but when Akturkoglu stepped up his spot kick shaved Karl Darlow’s left post and missed, which felt correct. Continue reading...

arts.sum: Kerem Akturkoglu missed a late penalty for the home side.
